This fellowship is fixed-term for 2 years from 1 October 2015 and is attached to Linacre College where the visiting fellow may reside and have full rights and access to facilities.

The Blaschko Fellow will manage their own academic research and administrative activities including testing hypotheses, analysing scientific data, developing new scientific techniques, and contributing ideas for new research projects.

Successful applicants will be expected to demonstrate:

- that they have, or expect to obtain through the submission of their thesis by the time of the interview, a PhD in an appropriate science;
- evidence that highlights accuracy and attention to detail, methodical work, reliability, competence with computer skills, and the ability to participate in scientific discussion within the group;
- experience of basic laboratory management, including awareness of health and safety issues and ordering of consumables.

The fellowship will provide a salary of £30,434 - £37,394 p.a., college fees and an award of £2,000 p.a. for travel to conferences and laboratory expenses.

The successful applicant can join any one of the research groups in the Department of Pharmacology (www.pharm.ox.ac.uk) including the MRC Brain Network Dynamics Unit (www.mrc.ox.ac.uk) depending on their interests - applicants should specify which group they would like to work with in their application.

Applications can only be considered from graduate students in pharmacology or related areas of study resident outside of the UK, preference will be given to students resident in Continental Europe due to the terms of the Blaschko Trust.

The closing date for applications is 12.00 noon on Wednesday 8 April 2015.

51.758038 -1.251374 30434 37394 GBP admin@pharm.ox.ac.uk https://source.data.ox.ac.uk/vacancies/117652/0011854354.pdf https://data.ox.ac.uk/id/vacancy/117436 https://data.ox.ac.uk/doc/vacancy/117436 https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.display_form?p_display_in_irish=N&p_company=10&p_refresh_search=Y&p_process_type=&p_recruitment_id=117436&p_form_profile_detail=&p_display_apply_ind=Y&p_internal_external=E&p_applicant_no= 2015-03-04T09:09:25+00:00 2015-04-24T12:00:00+01:00 MRC Unit, Department of Pharmacology, Mansfield Road, Oxford
Applications are invited to join a multidisciplinary team at the MRC Unit in the Department of Pharmacology, University of Oxford. We seek a Postdoctoral Neuroscientist to develop, execute and analyse a combination of in vivo electrophysiological, behavioural and optogenetics experiments in rodents as part of a scientific project that is designed to elucidate the normal functions of midbrain dopaminergic neurons as well as their dysfunction in models of Parkinson’s disease. Interested candidates should hold a PhD or equivalent qualification (or MD) in a relevant area of research, and should have a promising track record in original research in their particular field of neuroscience. Candidates are also expected to have some technical expertise in neurophysiology, and to provide evidence of creative and critical thinking as applied to the advancement and delivery of a focused and cohesive programme of research.

The postholder will work with Professor Peter J Magill and Dr Paul D Dodson at the MRC Unit, Department of Pharmacology. The group uses a transdisciplinary approach to elucidate the function and dysfunction of the basal ganglia, and employs innovative electrophysiological, anatomical, behavioural and genetics-based techniques to study these circuits in reduced preparations and the whole organism.

This is a fixed-term post of 32 months, funded by the Medical Research Foundation, with an initial probationary period, to start on 1 June 2015 or as soon as possible thereafter.

The closing date for applications is 12.00 noon on Friday 24 April 2015.
